snippet: Amir Hekmati, the Marine veteran imprisoned in Iran longer than any other American inmate there, resumed a suspended hunger strike on Monday out of despair over the apparent paralysis in his case.
abstract: American Marine veteran Amir Hekmati, who has been in Iranian prison since 2011, resumes hunger strike out of despair that his case seems to be stalled.
lead_paragraph: Amir Hekmati, the Marine veteran imprisoned in Iran longer than any other American inmate there, resumed a suspended hunger strike on Monday out of despair over the apparent paralysis in his case.

headline.main: Iran: American Prisoner Resumes Hunger Strike Over Languishing Case
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Iran: American Prisoner Resumes Hunger Strike Over Languishing Case
